title: Postecoglou sacked by Spurs after Europa League win
byline: Ange Postecoglou has been sacked as Tottenham manager 16 days after leading them to victory in the Europa League final.

title: Former Presidents to think twice in attending state ceremonies over disrespect
byline: The former Presidents remain disappointed over seating arrangements made for them at a recent function at the BMICH, and have decided to think twice in accepting invitations extended by the government for state events in the future as a result, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Coconut harvest to drop further this year, imports to continue
byline: The Coconut Research Institute has forecast a further decline of 250 million nuts crop for the first half of 2025 harvest during the first half of this year compared to last year, the current harvest stands at 1,407 million nuts for the first half of 2025, according to statistics from it.

title: ’Massive’ Russian strike days after air base attacks
byline: Russia launched a ’’massive’’ drone and missile strike on Ukraine’s capital and other areas early on Friday, days after Ukraine’s surprise attack on its air bases.

title: Ajith P. Perera questions AKD’s decision to pardon convict ten days after verdict
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Ajith P. Perera questioned the action by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to grant a pardon to a person just ten days after his conviction.

title: Van carrying schoolchildren crashes in Ragala; Three injured
byline: A van transporting schoolchildren veered off the road and overturned yesterday afternoon, injuring a schoolgirl, a woman, and the driver, Ragala Police said.

title: Sri Lankan prisons overcrowded with non-convicted inmates: Justice Minister
byline: Sri Lankan prisons are severely overcrowded, with the majority of inmates being non-convicted individuals held on suspicion, Justice Minister Harshana Nanayakkara revealed in Parliament yesterday.

title: Rainy conditions, winds expected from June 10: Met Department
byline: Rainy conditions are expected to intensify in the south-western parts of the island starting June 10, accompanied by strong gusty winds both over land and in surrounding sea areas, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Economic Centres in Sri Lanka have failed to be reality: Minister
byline: Trade and Food Security Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe admitted in Parliament yesterday that all economic centres in Sri Lanka have failed to achieve their intended objectives and have not been realistic.

title: Hajj message from the Prime Minister
byline: On this sacred day, our fellow Muslim brothers and sisters in Sri Lanka and around the world celebrate the Hajj festival with deep devotion, undertaking the holy pilgrimage in a spirit of unity, brotherhood, and coexistence rising above self-interest and embracing shared values.

title: JCPSM ends strike, but lab technicians to continue
byline: The Joint Council for Professions Supplementary to Medicine (JCPSM) has decided to call off its ongoing islandwide strike in hospitals following a lengthy discussion held yesterday, JCPSM General Secretary Chanaka Dharmawickrama said.

title: Poson week begins today with special arrangements for devotees
byline: Poson Week begins today, and all necessary arrangements have been made to ensure the convenience and safety of devotees attending the National Poson Festival, Anuradhapura District Secretary K.P.R. Wimalasuriya said.

title: On board the driverless lorries hoping to transform China’s transport industry
byline: They rumble down the highway between Beijing and Tianjin port: big lorries, loaded up and fully able to navigate themselves.

title: Sigiriya becomes nation’s first sustainable destination
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism sector has reached a major sustainability milestone, with Sigiriya being officially declared as the country’s first sustainable destination.

title: Rubber exports dip in April as production continues downward trend
byline: Sri Lanka’s rubber sector continued to face headwinds in the first quarter of 2025, with the Central Bank confirming a decline in production, reflecting the persistent challenges in the industry, according to Forbes and Walkers Commodity Brokers’ latest rubber report.

title: Prisons Dept. responds to inmate’s pardon
byline: Amid growing criticism over the Presidential pardon granted to a convicted fraud suspect, the Department of Prisons has issued a statement defending the release of W.M. Athula Tilakaratne, a former finance company manager found guilty of misappropriating Rs. 4 million.

title: Complaint filed against Virat Kohli seeking his arrest
byline: A complaint has been filed against cricketer Virat Kohli, a member of the RCB squad, at Bengaluru’s Cubbon Park Police Station over the June 4 stampede near Chinnaswamy Stadium, which left 11 dead and dozens injured.

title: Education Ministry launches first digital food safety curriculum via E-Thaksalawa
byline: In commemoration of World Food Safety Day, the Ministry of Education and the National Institute of Education (NIE) launched Sri Lanka’s first digital curriculum on food safety via the E-Thaksalawa platform.

title: Hajj blesses national endeavour to build enlightened Sri Lanka: President
byline: The sacred observance of Hajj, uniting Muslim devotees through common faith, blesses Sri Lanka’s national endeavour to build an enlightened Sri Lanka, one founded upon brotherhood and goodwill rather than division, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said in his Hajj greetings.

title: Trump administration imposes sanctions on four ICC judges in unprecedented move
byline: President Donald Trump’s administration on Thursday imposed sanctions on four judges at the International Criminal Court, an unprecedented retaliation over the war tribunal’s issuance of an arrest warrant for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and a past decision to open a case into alleged war crimes by U.S. troops in Afghanistan.

title: US brings back El Salvador deportee to face charges
byline: Kilmar Ábrego García, a 29-year-old from El Salvador mistakenly deported in March, has been returned to the US to face prosecution on two federal criminal charges.
